sen.j: 漆部友背（ぬりべのともせ、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: NURIBE no Tomose is a person who lived in Asuka period, although his birth and death dates are not known.
NURIBE no Tomose is a person who lived during Japan's Asuka period, although his birth and death dates are not known.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルのネイティブチェックを参考に修正しました。
sen.e: NURIBE no Tomose is a person who lived during Japan's Asuka period, although his birth and death dates are not known.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは同じ。
sen.e: In old Japanese syllabary characters, his name reads "NURIBE no Tomose," the same as in modern syllabary characters.
In the old Japanese kana syllabary, his name reads "NURIBE no Tomose," the same as in the modern kana syllabary.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルのネイティブチェックを参考に修正しました。
sen.e: In the old Japanese kana syllabary, his name reads "NURIBE no Tomose," the same as in the modern kana syllabary.
NURIBE no Tomose did not have a "kabane" name, a symbol which describes his family's relationship with the central government.
NURIBE no Tomose did not have a "kabane" name, a symbol which describes his family's relationship with the central government.
NURIBE no Tomose did not have a "kabane" name, a symbol which describes his family's relationship with the central government.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子に（天武天皇）側につき、都を脱出した大津皇子に同行した。
sen.e: During the Jinshin War in 672, Nuribe took side of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama, who later became Emperor Tenmu), and accompanied Prince Otsu's escape journey.
During the Jinshin War of 672, Nuribe took side of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama, who later became Emperor Tenmu), and accompanied Prince Otsu in his escape from the capital.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルのネイティブチェックを参考に修正しました。
sen.e: During the Jinshin War of 672, Nuribe took side of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama, who later became Emperor Tenmu), and accompanied Prince Otsu in his escape from the capital.

sen.j: 漆部は漆塗りを職掌とする民で、漆部造が支配した。
sen.e: Nuribe is a trade group whose duty is lacquering, and the group was controlled by Nuribe miyatsuko.
Nuribe is a trade group whose duty is lacquering, and the group was controlled by Nuribe miyatsuko.
Nuribe is a trade group whose duty is lacquering, and the group was controlled by Nuribe miyatsuko.

sen.j: 漆部友背もその出と思われる。
sen.e: NURIBE no Tomose is believed to be from the group.
NURIBE no Tomose is believed to be from the group.
NURIBE no Tomose is believed to be from the group.

sen.j: 壬申の乱の勃発時、友背は近江宮がある大津市にいたらしい。
sen.e: When the Jinshin War broke out, Tomose was believed to be in Otsu city where Omi no miya was located.
When the Jinshin War broke out, Tomose was believed to be in Otsu where Omi no miya was located.
sen.cmt: リンク表記で「大津市」となっていますが当時は「大津」なので（web表記も「大津」）、Cityは削除しました。
sen.e: When the Jinshin War broke out, Tomose was believed to be in Otsu where Omi no miya was located.

sen.j: 大海人皇子が挙兵を決めたとき、その子高市皇子と大津皇子は敵の本拠である大津を脱し、二手に分かれて父のあとを追った。
sen.e: When Oama no Miko (Prince Oama) decided to raise an army, his two sons, Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) and Prince Otsu, left Otsu where their enemy had a headquarter, and followed their father, each taking a different route.

When Oama no Miko (Prince Oama) decided to raise an army, his two sons, Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) and Prince Otsu, left Otsu where their enemy had a headquarters, and followed their father, each taking a different route.

When Oama no Miko (Prince Oama) decided to raise an army, his two sons, Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) and Prince Otsu, left Otsu where their enemy had a headquarters, and followed their father, each taking a different route.

sen.j: このうち大津皇子の一行は25日深夜に伊勢国の鈴鹿関に到達し、翌朝朝明郡の迹太川の辺で合流を果たした。
sen.e: Of the two parties, Prince Otsu arrived at the Suzuka barrier in the Ise Province around midnight on the 25th, and joined the other party by the Too River in Asake-no-kori.
Of the two parties, Prince Otsu arrived at the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint in the Ise Province around midnight on the 25th, and joined the other party by the Too-gawa River in Asake-no-kori.
sen.cmt: 鈴鹿関の訳語は用語集に従いました。Too RiverもToo-gawa Riverに修正しました。
sen.e: Of the two parties, Prince Otsu arrived at the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint in the Ise Province around midnight on the 25th, and joined the other party by the Too-gawa River in Asake-no-kori.

sen.j: 友背はこの一行の中にいた。
sen.e: Tomose was a member of the Prince Otsu party.
Tomose was a member of the Prince Otsu party.
Tomose was a member of the Prince Otsu party.

sen.j: ともに朝明郡にたどりついたのは、大分恵尺、難波三綱、駒田忍人、山辺安摩呂、小墾田猪手、埿部視枳、大分稚臣、根金身であった。
sen.e: Other members who arrived in Asake-no-kori with Prince Otsu were OKIDA no Esaka, NANIWA no Mitsuna, KOMADA no Oshihito, YAMAHE no Yasumaro, OHARITA no Ite, HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki, OKIDA no Wakaomi, and NE no Kanemi.

Other members who arrived in Asake-no-kori with Prince Otsu were OKIDA no Esaka, NANIWA no Mitsuna, KOMADA no Oshihito, YAMAHE no Yasumaro, OHARITA no Ite, HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki, OKIDA no Wakaomi, and NE no Kanemi.

Other members who arrived in Asake-no-kori with Prince Otsu were OKIDA no Esaka, NANIWA no Mitsuna, KOMADA no Oshihito, YAMAHE no Yasumaro, OHARITA no Ite, HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki, OKIDA no Wakaomi, and NE no Kanemi.

sen.j: この後の内戦で塗部友背が果たした活動については記録がない。
sen.e: There are no records about achievements of NURIBE no Tomose in the civil war afterwards.
There are no records about achievements of NURIBE no Tomose in the civil war afterwards.
There are no records about achievements of NURIBE no Tomose in the civil war afterwards.
